condition.description:
The colon and rectum are part of the large intestine. Colorectal cancer occurs when tumors form in the lining of the large intestine. It is common in both men and women. The risk of developing colorectal cancer rises after age 50. You're also more likely to get it if you have colorectal polyps, a family history of colorectal cancer, ulcerative colitis or Crohn's disease, eat a diet high in fat, or smoke.

Symptoms of colorectal cancer include

  • Diarrhea or constipation
  • A feeling that your bowel does not empty completely
  • Blood (either bright red or very dark) in your stool
  • Stools that are narrower than usual
  • Frequent gas pains or cramps, or feeling full or bloated
  • Weight loss with no known reason
  • Fatigue
  • Nausea or vomiting

Because you may not have symptoms at first, it's important to have screening tests. Everyone over 50 should get screened. Tests include colonoscopy and tests for blood in the stool. Treatments for colorectal cancer include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation, or a combination. Surgery can usually cure it when it is found early.

NIH: National Cancer Institute
condition.name: Colorectal cancer

carousel_items: Avastin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the first infusion.
Your blood pressure may go up while you're taking Avastin. Check your blood pressure regularly (every 2 to 3 weeks) and talk to your doctor if there are any changes.
You may bleed more easily while you're taking Avastin. Be careful and watch for unusual bleeding or bleeding that doesn't stop easily.
If you're a female, you should avoid getting pregnant while taking Avastin and for at least 6 months after you stop taking it.
Talk to your doctor before getting a vaccine. While you're taking Avastin, the vaccine may not work as well or you might increase your chance of getting sick.

basics.benefits_moa: Avastin is a monoclonal antibody. It binds to an important factor that blocks the blood supply to a tumor and stops the growth of cancer.
basics.bottom_line: Avastin is an effective, first-line option when used together with other medicines for certain types of cancers, but it has to be given in a clinic or hospital and it has many severe side effects.
downsides: Not the best choice if you have heart or kidney problems.
Avastin can damage the ovaries. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
It may take longer for you to heal. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice if you have heart or kidney problems.
Avastin can damage the ovaries. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
It may take longer for you to heal. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

upsides: In studies, taking Avastin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines extended the lives of people with certain types of cancers better than not taking Avastin.
Treats brain, cervical, colorectal, lung, and kidney cancers.
Avastin is used as a first- or second-line choice along with other medicines for certain types of cancers.
Avastin is typically given every 2 to 3 weeks and can be given along with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines during the same visit.

upsides_processed.orig: In studies, taking Avastin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines extended the lives of people with certain types of cancers better than not taking Avastin.
Treats brain, cervical, colorectal, lung, and kidney cancers.
Avastin is used as a first- or second-line choice along with other medicines for certain types of cancers.
Avastin is typically given every 2 to 3 weeks and can be given along with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines during the same visit.

drugs.name: Avastin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Avastin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the first infusion.
Your blood pressure may go up while you're taking Avastin. Check your blood pressure regularly (every 2 to 3 weeks) and talk to your doctor if there are any changes.
You may bleed more easily while you're taking Avastin. Be careful and watch for unusual bleeding or bleeding that doesn't stop easily.
If you're a female, you should avoid getting pregnant while taking Avastin and for at least 6 months after you stop taking it.
Talk to your doctor before getting a vaccine. While you're taking Avastin, the vaccine may not work as well or you might increase your chance of getting sick.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach or intestine damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

risks_warnings.title: Lower wound healing
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can lower your ability to heal from a wound, especially from surgery. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery, and until the surgical wound is fully healed.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can lower your ability to heal from a wound, especially from surgery. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery, and until the surgical wound is fully healed.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause severe or fatal bleeding in the brain, nose, stomach, and vagina, and may also cause coughing up blood. Avastin can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause severe or fatal bleeding in the brain, nose, stomach, and vagina, and may also cause coughing up blood. Avastin can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can increase your risk for heart failure. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of cardiovascular disease.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can increase your risk for heart failure. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of cardiovascular disease.

risks_warnings.title: Ovary damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause ovarian failure in premenopausal women. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause ovarian failure in premenopausal women. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause kidney problems due to too much protein in your urine. Talk to your doctor about getting regular kidney tests while taking Avastin.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause kidney problems due to too much protein in your urine. Talk to your doctor about getting regular kidney tests while taking Avastin.

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

userStories.tip: research and understand the actual reason to take this medicine, as well as any medicine - than it will be helpful. Don't take it "just because". High quality Aspirin (e.g. Bayer) is much better (better effect without harming)

drugs.name: Aspirin

off-label_indications.indication: Blood clot prevention for blood vessel graft
Blood clot prevention for atrial fibrillation
Blood clot prevention for artificial heart valve
Blood clot prevention for peripheral artery disease
High blood pressure prevention for IVF pregnancy
condition_url_name: High blood pressure prevention for IVF pregnancy

carousel_items_processed.orig: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.
